review_title: Overworked but I love the students
pros: The students are amazing The university is making positive changes
cons: 1. Management has a distorted view of reality. They do not understand how stressed and overwhelmed the staff is or what the students need. 2. We need more staff and better infrastructure before the expand the university

pros: The mission is very important
cons: Low pay and president steals cost of living raises provided by state President lies about everything but has the board suckered There is pressure to pass incompetent students and many who we graduate lack basic skills Students cheat terribly but face no consequences when reported There is discrimination against non-Blacks There is no customer service, about every system is broken. Jobs don’t get done paperwork gets lost, calls don’t get returned… not once or once in a while but most of the time and over and over Nepotism leads to incompetence Employees are bullied into silence, we are not allowed to address problems Students are increasingly entitled and expect high grades for No or poor work

review_title: There are Changes with Each New Administration
pros:
Family environment.
The campus is beautiful. 
Dover is a nice place to raise a family.
Worked with some really great people.
cons:
Pays very low in comparison to other universities in the area.
Do not give annual raises, although they do require annual evaluations.
In my opinion, doesn't really seem to listen to staff members' needs.

review_title: Working and had to get food stamps
pros: You earn paid time off and sick time, you can earn a degree for a fraction of the cost regular tuition.
cons: Secretaries do not even receive the median pay for our positions. The culture is stagnant due to people being in their positions for years collecting bonuses and the monies received do not trickle down to the janitors and secretaries. Many buildings need to be updated.

job_title: Agriculture Research Technician in Dover, DE
pros: Working at Delaware State University has helped me to grow and expand my knowledge in the agricultural area with new technological concepts that are currently being used to help the agriculture sector to advance in these uncertain and changing times.
cons: The post is a bit limited.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Dover, DE
pros: Free trips depending on which lab you work in
cons: Admin is the worst. People don't like to work nor do they know how to do their jobs. Paperwork takes forever. This place is so stressful to work at

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Castle, DE
pros: Great exposure and networking within Student Affairs career path through conferences paid for by the department. Hands on experience on event planning and student engagement.
cons: Department size is very small with most administrative work left for you to do unless you trust the student workers to do it. You have to work evening and weekends to assist with student events.

job_title: Administration and Professor in Dover, DE
pros: Experience the jungle life before you run away.
cons:
Cluttered with strugglers at levels
Homeless and criminals on campus
Faculty and staff are busy writing to the Human Resources against each other
The highest turnover, two professors resigned from one department over two years. Three professors were fired. 
Professors use students against each other or they fail. Random grade assignment
Professors fight like kids and one professor was escorted by police
They hire faculty with scientific misconduct
Racial tension could be dangerous
Students use "F" word in disputes with professors
Faculty don't show up to teach
FERPA violation, no confidentiality on student grades
Bribes and embezzlement are common

job_title: Consultant/Chef De Projet Gouvernance Et Qualité in Dover, DE
pros: Delaware State prides itself on being the nations best HBCU. Although there is a lack of funding they do their best to make the school affordable and accommodating.
cons:
People have been there for so long they no longer do their job to the best of their abilities. 
As well the salaries are so low they can not staff properly.

job_title: Undergraduate Research Intern in Dover, DE
pros: Many research opportunities available with highly intelligent and experienced faculty/staff. Great experience for undergraduate students with very little credentials on resume/CV.
cons: Very poor administration and student employment office; strongly restricted work hours (no more than 10 per week).
